titles.title: A bill to prohibit payment of Federal retirement benefits, except in certain cases, to those who are not retired as defined under the Social Security Act.

bill.summary: 10/22/1987--Introduced. Prohibits the Federal Government from paying retirement benefits to or through any person who ceases to be employed with the Federal Government after the year 2000 unless such person is retired as defined under the Social Security Act. Excepts from such prohibition former public safety officers and former members of the armed forces who have been exposed to the dangers of hostile combat.
